value: Remnants of whaling station at Kvalrossbukta

Bear Island is named after a bear and is the southernmost island in Svalbard. Along with the adjacent waters, it was declared a nature reserve in 2002.

There are very few opportunities for individual travel to Bjørnøya. A few yachts make landfall, usually en route between the Norwegian mainland and Spitsbergen. A small number of cruising ships have visited the island, but tourism is otherwise almost nonexistent.

value: Urd, at 536 m the highest point of the island, is in Miseryfjellet, the mountainous eastern part of Bear Island.
